isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES FOR 7.3 LITER DIESEL ENGINES - INJECTION PUMP DYNAMIC TIMING - DYNAMIC INJECTION TIMING

svcproc.title: DYNAMIC INJECTION TIMING
svcproc.para: Dynamic timing is checked using the Tach-n-Time instrument (ZTSE-4142) with a clamp pick-up (ZTSE-4142-73) attached to an engine mounted line pressure sensor.
The dynamic timing specification at 2000 RPM, no load, is 3.5° ± 2° BTDC as measured with ZTSE-4142.

important.para: THE 7.3 LITER FUEL INJECTION PUMPS FOR INTERNATIONAL(r) 1000, 3000, 4000, S-SERIES AND METRO II APPLICATIONS, AND FORD MOTOR COMPANY E & F SERIES APPLICATIONS ARE TIMED IDENTICALLY AT THE FACTORY. HOWEVER, DYNAMIC TIMING SPECIFICATIONS FOR SERVICE ARE DIFFERENT DUE TO DIFFERENT TIMING METERS USED BY INTERNATIONAL AND FORD. EACH METER HAS DIFFERENT ELECTRONIC CIRCUITRY AND FILTERING WHICH ACCOUNTS FOR THE DIFFERENT SERVICE DYNAMIC TIMING SPECIFICATIONS. THE DYNAMIC TIMING SPECIFICATION LISTED ABOVE IS VALID ONLY WHEN USING THE TACH-N-TIME (ZTSE-4142). OTHER TIMING METERS WILL NOT PROVIDE THE SAME RESULTS.

svcproc.para: Timing advance, measured at 2000 RPM, no load, with the HPCA Solenoid activated MUST be 2_ min.( above the first timing check.)

step1.para: Slide the plastic protective cap off the line pressure sensor (Figure 5.24).
Clamp the "alligator style" pick-up (ZTSE-4142-73) to the line pressure sensor on the #4 cylinder injection nozzle.
Connect the ground clamp from the pick-up clamp harness to an appropriate ground as shown in Figure 5.25.

important.para: LINE PRESSURE SENSOR AND PICK-UP CLAMP MUST BE DRY. WET CONDITIONS CAN CAUSE ERRATIC READINGS. IF ERRATIC READINGS ARE OBSERVED, REMOVE THE PICK-UP CLAMP AND DRY THE CLAMP AND LINE PRESSURE SENSOR WITH A CLEAN, DRY CLOTH. SPRAY THE PICK-UP CLAMP AND LINE PRESSURE SENSOR ON ALL SURFACES, WITH A WATER DISPLACING SUBSTANCE, SUCH AS WD-40(r) AND RECLAMP THE PICK-UP TO THE LINE PRESSURE SENSOR.

step1.para: Set "SENSOR SIGNAL" rocker switch to the "CLAMP ON" position. Refer to Figure 5.26.
Insert the magnetic probe into the magnetic pick-up access hole (top hole) located on the crankcase front cover. See Figure 5.25.
Plug the magnetic probe terminal into the crankshaft sensor jack on the ZTSE-4142 body labeled "MAGNETIC PICK-UP". Refer to Figure 5.26.
Set rocker switch to "MAGNETIC PICK-UP" position. Refer to Figure 5.26.
Connect the ZTSE-4142 battery leads to the vehicle battery (red to "+", black to "-"). Display should light up and read (Set...20.0).

caution.para: THE ZTSE-4142 MUST BE GROUNDED TO THE ENGINE BLOCK. REFER TO FIGURE 5.26.

step1.para: The timing meter automatically reads a 20° timing offset. No offset adjustment is required for the 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine.
Make sure all cables and wires are clear of fan, belts or any other moving parts. Keep wires away from exhaust manifolds.
Start engine. The sensor light on the ZTSE-4142 should be blinking regularly, indicating proper function of the connectors. Allow the engine to reach normal operating temperature.

important.para: HPCA SOLENOID MALFUNCTIONING AFFECTS TIMING. VERIFY PROPER HPCA OpERATION AS FOLLOWS:

step1.para: WITH ENGINE COLD (Coolant temperature below 85° F).

step2.para: With timing meter properly installed, disconnect yellow wire (Figure 5.27) to DEACTIVATE the HPCA Solenoid.
If RPM on timing meter decreases or a timing change is observed, the HPCA Solenoid is functioning.

If NO decrease in RPM or timing is observed, the HPCA or the temperature sensor in the top/rear inboard side of the left cylinder head is faulty. Confirm temperature sensor function and replace HPCA or sensor as required.

step1.para: WITH ENGINE WARM (Coolant temperature above 140° F).

step2.para: With the timing meter properly installed and the HPCA Solenoid Connected, use a jumper wire to activate the HPCA Solenoid. Refer to Figure 5.28.
If RPM on the meter increases or a timing change is observed, the HPCA Solenoid is functioning.
If NO increase in RPM or timing is observed, the HPCA or the temperature sensor is not functioning. Confirm temperature sensor operation and replace HPCA or sensor as required.
